feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 1:10PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Continues Into Early Tuesday Morning at Shishmaref... North to northwest winds 20 to 35 mph with elevated surf west of Cape Espenberg through early Tuesday morning. Waves will wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 12:35PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cool and Wet Conditions Into Wednesday... The cool and wet pattern will persist through mid week with snow levels falling to around 2000 ft by tonight. Additional snowfall in the Alaska Range of 2 to 6 inches is expected in Denali Park, and the Eastern Alaska Range. South winds near the Alaska Range passes will gust to 55 mph
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 12:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow in the Brooks Range... Snow levels in the Brooks Range are around 5000 feet this afternoon and will fall to around 2000 feet overnight and Tuesday with up to 4 inches of accumulation expected by Tuesday afternoon. The heaviest snowfall will be east of the Dalton Highway. Temperatures will also be falling with the low temperatures in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 9:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Matanuska Valley and Susitna Valley. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 9:17AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WATER ON AREA RIVERS AND STREAMS... Accumulated rainfall Sunday night into this morning with additional rainfall today into Tuesday may bring area creeks and streams to bankfull or slightly above bankfull. This includes, but is not limited to Ship Creek, Campbell Creek, Chester Creek and Glacier Creek (Girdwood).

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Locally Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of locally dense fog will persist early this morning, especially in river valleys and low-lying areas, with visibility reduced to 1/4 mile or less at times. Expect improving conditions by 8 AM to 9 AM. Slow down, be prepared for rapid fluctuations in visibility, and allow extra time to reach your destination.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:34AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy fog this Morning... Clear skies, light winds and wet ground has allowed patchy fog to develop early this morning. The fog was locally dense in spots with visibilities under one quarter mile. Motorists should exercise caution this morning as visibilities may change suddenly over very short distances.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 5:55AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog This Morning... Patchy dense fog will produce poor visibility this morning along the Downeast coast. Please allow plenty of travel time for the morning commute. Slow down and turn on low beam headlights.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 09 at 3:55AM EDT until August 09 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers will be heavily swamped by waves. Waves 3 to 6 feet this morning gradually subsiding this afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Locally Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of locally dense fog will persist early this morning, especially in river valleys and low-lying areas, with visibility reduced to 1/4 mile or less at times. Expect improving conditions by 8 AM to 9 AM. Slow down, be prepared for rapid fluctuations in visibility, and allow extra time to reach your destination.

entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Washington; Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington; Simcoe Highlands; Yakima Valley

cap:geocode.value: WAZ024 WAZ026 WAZ027 WAZ028 WAZ029 WAZ521

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:41AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Some Dense Fog Possible Early This Morning... Fog is developing across parts of south central and southeast Wisconsin early this morning, with calm winds and lingering low level moisture. Most visibility values are between 1 and 4 miles. Some dense fog is possible as well, which may reduce visibility values to 1/4 mile at times. Slow down and use low beam headlights
entry.cap:areaDesc: Columbia; Dane; Dodge; Fond Du Lac; Green; Green Lake; Iowa; Jefferson; Kenosha; Lafayette; Marquette; Milwaukee; Ozaukee; Racine; Rock; Sauk; Sheboygan; Walworth; Washington; Waukesha

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Locally Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of locally dense fog will persist early this morning, especially in river valleys and low-lying areas, with visibility reduced to 1/4 mile or less at times. Expect improving conditions by 8 AM to 9 AM. Slow down, be prepared for rapid fluctuations in visibility, and allow extra time to reach your destination.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Clark; Crawford; Grant; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Richland; Taylor; Trempealeau; Vernon

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 09 at 2:58AM CDT until August 09 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 2 to 5 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, Ozaukee, Milwaukee, Racine, and Kenosha counties.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued August 09 at 2:41AM CDT until August 09 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter to one half mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and northeast Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 8 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Air
